```{r}

library(ggplot2) # visualization package
library(dplyr) # provides functions for summarizing and data manipulation
library(readr) # provides function for reading in data via .CSV file
library(janitor) # provides utility functions for data cleaning and manipulation
library(ggthemes) # provides a collection of themes for customizing the appearance of plots created with ggplot2
library(plotly) # allows interactive chart

```


```{r}

tip_data <- read.csv("tip.csv")

```

```{r}

head(tip_data)
summary(tip_data)
str(tip_data)
cat("\n--- Missing Values Check ---\n")
print(colSums(is.na(tip_data)))

```

```{r}

cat("\n--- Scatter Plot of Tip vs. Total Bill ---\n")
ggplot(tip_data, aes(x = total_bill, y = tip)) +
  geom_point(color = "blue", alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", col = "red") + # Add a linear trend line
  labs(title = "Tip Amount vs. Total Bill",
       x = "Total Bill ($)",
       y = "Tip Amount ($)") +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}

tip_model <- lm(tip ~ total_bill, data = tip_data)

cat("\n--- Regression Model Object Created ---\n")
print(tip_model)

```

```{r}

cat("\n--- Model Summary and Evaluation ---\n")
model_summary <- summary(tip_model)
print(model_summary)

```

```{r}

new_bills <- data.frame(total_bill = c(10.00, 25.00, 40.00))
predicted_tips <- predict(tip_model, newdata = new_bills)
prediction_results <- new_bills %>%
  mutate(predicted_tip = predicted_tips)
cat("\n--- Model Predictions ---\n")
print(prediction_results)

```
